📚 CLASE EN VIVO Evaluación NIVEL A1 - Choco Inglés
Notas Generales
Objetivo

Lograr que los estudiantes pasen con éxito todas las habilidades y demuestren que tienen los conocimientos necesarios que se requieren para ser certificados como un hablante de inglés en nivel A1

¿Hasta dónde se evalua en esta prueba?

Esta semana se estudia desde el módulo Choco Turbo hasta el módulo Semana 11: A1 TESTS PARA APROBAR EL NIVEL A1

Notas profesor

Este es el formato que el docente debe llenar https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1M6ymm7p4ZyLHwivDCiutwZ9XufRZbJIzYYVEzYUS3Yw/edit?gid=0#gid=0

Saludos

Los saludos deben ser reales. Un estudiante dice un saludo a otro compañero y este debe darle una respuesta.

Saludos Básicos

Palabra

Traducción

Frase Ejemplo

Traducción Frase Ejemplo

Hi

Hola

Hi! How are you?

¡Hola! ¿Cómo estás?

Hello

Hola

Hello, nice to meet you!

¡Hola, un placer conocerte!

Good morning

Buenos días

Good morning, everyone!

¡Buenos días a todos!

Good afternoon

Buenas tardes

Good afternoon, sir.

Buenas tardes, señor.

Good evening

Buenas noches

Good evening, how was your day?

Buenas noches, ¿cómo estuvo tu día?

Hey

Hola (informal)

Hey, what’s up?

¡Hola! ¿Qué pasa?

¿Qué tal?

¿Qué tal, amigo?

¿Cómo estás?

How’s it going at work?

¿Cómo va todo en el trabajo?

How do you do?

¿Cómo está usted?

How do you do, Mr. Smith?

¿Cómo está, Sr. Smith?

¿En qué has estado últimamente?

¿Cómo va tu semana?

How’s your week going so far?

¿Cómo va tu semana hasta ahora?

It’s a pleasure to see you again

Es un placer verte de nuevo

It’s a pleasure to see you again after so long.

Es un placer verte de nuevo después de tanto tiempo.
A1 Evaluación Vocabulario
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor?
  1. Muestra una lectura al estudiante y esté debe traducir lo que dice ese texto. Obs: Si el estudiante no puede interpretar lo que está leyendo, debe decir el significado de las palabras. Las palabras en negrita dentro de los textos indican palabras claves que tuvieron un refuerzo especial en la plataforma
  2. También debe hacer la prueba del ANKI: Cada estudiante abre su ANKI y va diciendo el significado de cada una de las tarjetas. Debe hacer un mínimo de 10 tarjetas en 1 minutos
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante?

Ser capaz de reconocer el significado de la palabra

Lecturas para evaluar el vocabulario
Evaluación 1 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students’ Version):

This story is about a boy and his sister. They are playing in the yard. He has many toys and she wants to use them.
"Can I play with this car?" she said.
"You can take one, but not all," he replied.

Their dad was at home when he saw them. "What are you doing?" he asked.
"We are playing," they said.
He smiled and gave them a snack.
"This is for you. You have been good," he said.

Later, they read a book about animals. Each animal is different. Some are big, some are small.
"How do animals live?" she asked.
"It depends on where they live," he replied.
There is a bear in the forest and a fish in the sea.

If you want to know more, read books.
Books can help you learn so much.
These books are not boring, but fun.
Other kids had fun with them, too.
They said, "Reading is fun!"

Which book will you choose next?
Will it be about dogs or cats?
By reading, you learn from stories.
An idea grows up from each page.
As you grow, you learn more.

Do your best, and read all you can!

Evaluación 2 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 2

One day, a girl saw some birds in her yard. She would make a picture because she like birds. She gave it to him.

She went into the house. “It is time to draw,” she said. She has pencils and paper.
“Look! I will draw two birds this time.”

She wanted to know more, so she began to write.
“I want to go to the park to see more birds,” she said.
“There are a number of birds there,” Dad said.

“But we have no way to go now.”
“We could ask the people next door,” he said.

“My friend has a bike,” she said. “I can go with him.”
“It is better than walking,” Dad said.
“It is the first time for this.”

She took her water bottle and bag. She had been ready all week.
“Let’s call Amy and ask who wants to go.”

At the park, she saw a bird with oil on its wings.
“Now I can find many birds!” she said.

They walked a long way and sat down under a tree.
They stayed all day. She did many pictures.

“You get better!” Dad said.
More kids come to see what she made.
“You may help others learn,” said a boy.

This part was the best part of her week.
There were birds flying over the trees.
The birds made a new sound.

“Let’s take a photo!” Dad said.
“Only a little wind today,” she said.
“It was work, but it was fun.”
“I know this place is very nice,” she said.

Evaluación 3 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 3

One day, after lunch, we went back to class.
The teacher said, “I have a good story for you. Look at me and listen.”

She said, “This is our book. I will read just one page. The boy’s name is Tom.”
She read the sentence: “The man is kind.”

I think it is fun when teachers say stories.
“It is a great story,” said Sam.
“Where did you get it?” he asked.

“It can help us read better,” she said.
We read through the book. It was so much fun.

We had to finish before we go home.
“Make a line,” the teacher said.
“Go to the right, not the left.”

“I want to read too,” said Anna.
She asked, “What means this word?”

My dad is old, but he reads to me.
He said, “If you find any hard words, ask.”

We all had the same book.
I will tell my mom about it.
The boy in the story can run fast.

I like to follow the words with my finger.
The teacher came to help me.
I want to read more books now.

We had to show the page to a friend.
“I will also draw the boy,” said Kim.
We looked around the room. Everyone smiled.

Let’s form a team to read.
We picked three kids. I was happy.

“I see one small cat in the book,” said Max.
The teacher said, “Now we will set the book on the shelf.”

We put it there and went to the door.
“It is the end of class,” she said.

“Does everyone have the paper?”
We took another one, well made.

The cat was not large, not big, but it was cute.
We must read that page again!

“Tom is nice. He can even help the cat.”
“It is such a sweet story,” I said.

We clapped, because we loved it.
“Now, we will turn the lights off,” the teacher said.

“Here is your bag,” she told me.
“Why do you smile so much?” she asked.

Evaluación 4 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 4

Today, the teacher said, “Please ask questions if you do not understand.”
We went to class early. The men who work at the school cleaned the floor.

We sat and read a short story.
“You need to listen,” the teacher said.

“This land has many places with different animals.”
When we go home, we tell our mom what we learned. She helps us with reading.

Next, we will move to another class.
“I will try to do my best,” I said.

The teacher is very kind.
She gave me a high-five with her hand.
We looked at a big picture of a tree.
Then we looked at it again.

We had to change our seats.
Then the lights went off.

We wanted to play a game with words.
“Spell this word: air,” the teacher said.
We talked about the air and how we breathe it.

The cat ran away from the door.
It is a nice animal.
In my house, I have two pets.

The teacher pointed to the board and said, “Point to the word ‘tree’ on the page.”
We also looked at the first letter of each word.

My mother helps me learn at home.
She helps me answer the questions.

Today I found a new book.
I want to study it more.

We are still in class.
I like to learn new things.

We should be ready to go outside.
We talked about America and what makes it special.

The world is big. We want to learn more.
The sun is high in the sky today.

Every kid has a book.
We sit near each other and talk.

Let’s add color to the map.
We talked about our favorite food.

The teacher stood between two desks.
This is our own book, not shared.

We looked below the desk and found a pencil.
We talked about a country with many plants.

I like to plant seeds in the garden.
This is the last week of school.

We love our school.
My father says I must go and learn.

I want to keep my books safe and clean.

A1 Evaluación Temas
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 2

Hace las preguntas para evaluar los temas que debe conocer en ese nivel como familia, info personal; aunque reconocemos que no se ha abarcado completamente.

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 2

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel básico

Preguntas para evaluar los temas
Tema 1: 1. Personal Information & Identity

  1. What’s your name?

  2. Where are you from?

  3. How old are you?

  4. Do you have brothers or sisters?

  5. What’s your mother's name?

  6. What’s your father's job?

  7. Do you have a big family?

  8. Are you married?

  9. Do you have children?

  10. What are your children’s names?

  11. What time do you wake up?

  12. What do you usually eat for breakfast?

  13. Do you like coffee or tea?

  14. What time do you go to bed?

  15. Can you cook?

  16. What do you do on weekends?

  17. What’s your favorite food?

  18. Do you speak English?

  19. What other languages do you speak?

  20. What’s your favorite color?

  21. What do you do? (What's your job?)

  22. Where do you live?

  23. Do you live in a house or an apartment?

  24. What’s your address?

  25. What’s your phone number?

  26. What’s your email address?

  27. What’s the weather like today?

  28. What day is it today?

  29. What time is it now?

  30. What’s your favorite day of the week?

  31. What do you do in the morning?

  32. What do you do in the evening?

  33. Do you have any pets?

  34. What’s your favorite animal?

  35. What’s your favorite sport?

  36. Can you play the guitar?

  37. What music do you like?

  38. What’s your favorite movie?

  39. What do you do in your free time?

  40. What time do you start work?

  41. What time do you finish work?

  42. Do you like traveling?

  43. Have you ever been to another country?

  44. Do you like learning English?

  45. What’s your favorite English word?

  46. What clothes are you wearing now?

  47. What do you usually wear to work?

  48. What’s your best friend’s name?

  49. Where does your best friend live?

  50. Tell me about your family.

Tema 2: 2. Family

  1. Who is your mom?

  2. What’s your dad’s name?

  3. Do you have a brother?

  4. How many sisters do you have?

  5. Is your grandma alive?

  6. Where does your grandpa live?

  7. Is your baby brother funny?

  8. How old is your child?

  9. What does your mom do?

  10. Does your dad like music?

  11. Do you live with your parents?

  12. How many children do you have?

  13. Is your husband at home now?

  14. What’s your wife’s name?

  15. Do you have a son or a daughter?

  16. Do your cousins live near you?

  17. Does your uncle visit often?

  18. What does your aunt like to cook?

  19. How many siblings do you have?

  20. Does your cousin have a pet?

  21. Do you have any grandchildren?

  22. What’s your nephew’s name?

  23. Is your niece still a child?

  24. Do you like your stepmom?

  25. Where does your stepdad work?

  26. Do you have a stepson or a stepdaughter?

  27. Is your partner friendly?

  28. Are you engaged?

  29. Was your grandpa a teacher?

  30. Who is your mother-in-law?

  31. Are you a twin?

  32. Do you have any adopted siblings?

  33. Who is the tallest in your family?

  34. Is your sister older than you?

  35. Are your parents kind?

  36. Do you live in a big household?

  37. Is your mom strict or relaxed?

  38. Who is the youngest in your family?

  39. Do you know your ancestors?

  40. How many people live in your house?

  41. Do you have a stepbrother?

  42. How old is your stepsister?

  43. Do you visit your great-grandparents?

  44. Do you have a half-brother or half-sister?

  45. Is your family close or distant?

  46. Who is the oldest person in your family?

  47. Do you know your family’s lineage?

  48. Who is the matriarch in your family?

  49. Are you close to your kin?

  50. Will you visit your family next weekend?

Tema 3: 3. Daily Routines ⏰🪥🍽️

  1. What time do you get up?

  2. Do you brush your teeth every morning?

  3. What do you do after breakfast?

  4. What time do you go to school or work?

  5. Do you take a shower in the morning or at night?

  6. What do you eat for breakfast?

  7. What time do you have lunch?

  8. Do you go to bed early or late?

  9. What do you do in the afternoon?

  10. Do you make your bed every day?

  11. What time do you finish work or school?

  12. Do you cook dinner?

  13. Do you watch TV in the evening?

  14. What time do you go to sleep?

  15. Do you use your phone before sleeping?

  16. Do you clean your room every day?

  17. What do you do on weekends?

  18. Do you drink coffee or tea in the morning?

  19. What time do you leave your house?

  20. Do you walk or take a bus to school/work?

  21. Do you study at night?

  22. What do you do before you sleep?

  23. Do you listen to music during the day?

  24. What time do you eat dinner?

  25. Do you do the same things every day?

A1 Evaluación Listening
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 3
  1. Opción 1: El profesor coloca un audio de reductores de ruido y el estudiante dice qué dijo el audio y lo traduce al español. (El estudiante dice: She’s tall - Ella es alta)
  2. Opción 2: El docente lee los reductores y el estudiante dice qué dijo el audio y lo traduce al español. (El estudiante dice: She’s tall - Ella es alta)
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 3

Debe poder entender los siguientes audios.

Audios a evaluar
Reductor Saludos y Despedidas Choco Turbo

Reductor Saludos y Despedidas Choco Turbo

Frase

Traducción de Frase

Hi! How are you?

¡Hola! ¿Cómo estás?

Hello, nice to meet you!

¡Hola, un placer conocerte!

Good morning, everyone!

¡Buenos días a todos!

Good afternoon, sir.

Buenas tardes, señor.

Good evening, how was your day?

Buenas noches, ¿cómo estuvo tu día?

Hey, what’s up?

¡Hola! ¿Qué pasa?

What’s up, buddy?

¿Qué tal, amigo?

How are you today?

¿Cómo estás hoy?

How’s it going at work?

¿Cómo va todo en el trabajo?

Bye! See you soon!

¡Adiós! ¡Nos vemos pronto!

Goodbye, take care!

Adiós, ¡cuídate!

See you later, alligator!

¡Nos vemos luego, cocodrilo!

See you soon, my friend!

¡Nos vemos pronto, amigo!

Take care and stay safe!

¡Cuídate y mantente a salvo!

See you tomorrow at school!

¡Nos vemos mañana en la escuela!

See you next time, John!

¡Nos vemos la próxima, John!

Have a good day at work!

¡Que tengas un buen día en el trabajo!

Have a nice day, everyone!

¡Que tengan un lindo día, todos!

A1 Evaluación Comprensión
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 4

Va a evaluar las estructuras que debe manejar en ese nivel como tiempos y verbos.

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 4

Debe poder comprender cualquiera de las siguientes lecturas

Lecturas a Evaluar
Lectura 1 Comprensión Nivel A1

1. My Family

I have a small family. I live with my parents and my brother. My mother is a teacher, and my father is a doctor. My brother is 10 years old. He likes to play soccer. We have a dog. Its name is Max. We love Max very much.

2. My House

I live in a big house. There are three bedrooms, a kitchen, a living room, and two bathrooms. My bedroom is small, but I like it. There is a bed, a desk, and a chair in my room. I also have a window with a nice view.

3. My Best Friend

My best friend is Maria. She is 20 years old. She lives in my neighborhood. We like to study and play together. Maria is very funny and kind. She likes to draw and listen to music. I like her because she always helps me.

Lectura 2 Comprensión Nivel A1

4. My Favorite Food

I love pizza! My favorite pizza has cheese, tomatoes, and chicken. I also like pasta and rice. For dessert, I like ice cream and chocolate. On weekends, my family eats dinner at a restaurant. We always enjoy the food!

5. A Day at School

I go to school from Monday to Friday. My classes start at 8:00 a.m. and finish at 3:00 p.m. My favorite subject is English. I also like math, but it is a little difficult. At school, I talk with my friends and play in the park during lunch.

6. My Hobbies

I have many hobbies. I like to play basketball and swim. I also like to read books and watch movies. On Saturdays, I go to the park to ride my bike. I enjoy drawing pictures, too. Hobbies make me happy.

7. The Weather

Today, the weather is sunny and warm. I like sunny days because I can go outside. In the summer, it is very hot, but I enjoy swimming. In the winter, it is cold and sometimes snowy. I wear a coat, scarf, and gloves in winter.

A1 Evaluación Speaking
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 5

Hace las preguntas para evaluar su capacidad de comunicarse y hablar en inglés

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 5

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel básico

Preguntas para evaluar el speaking
  1. How are you?
  2. What's your name?
  3. Where are you from?
  4. How old are you?
  5. When’s your birthday?
  6. Where do you live?
  7. What do you do?
  8. Where do you work/study?
  9. What's your favorite [book/movie/food/hobby/color]?
  10. What time is it?
  11. I need your help, can you help me please?
  12. What do you think about money/politics…?
  13. What will you do tomorrow?
  14. Do you have any plans for the weekend?
  15. Do you like to eat/play/sleep?
  16. What do you do in your free time?
  17. What's your phone number/email address?
  18. How was your day/weekend?
  19. Who’s your best friend?
  20. Do you have siblings/children/friends? How many?
  21. How do you say “arroz”?
  22. Are you married/single/engaged?
  23. I would like to know a little bit about you
  24. What would you do if…
  25. Would you like a sandwich?
  26. Would you like some water?
  27. Would you like to go to the park?
  28. Would you like to meet my friend?
  29. Would you like to watch a movie?
  30. Is it cold?
  31. Is it sunny today?
  32. What’s the weather like?
  33. Is it raining now?
  34. Can I have a coffee, please?
  35. What do you have the menu?
  36. Do you like pizza?
  37. Can you say "sorry"?
  38. How do you say "thank you"?
  39. Can you repeat, please?
  40. Can you open the door?
  41. Where is the bathroom?
  42. How do I go to the park?
A1 Evaluación Herramientas
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 6
  • Asegurarse de que todos los estudiantes tienen las actividades de este nivel realizadas para poder ser aprobados en esta evaluación.
  • El profesor hace una evaluación del ANKI de cada estudiante tal y como se hace en las clases en vivo regulares; la diferencia radica en que el profesor evalúa (sin previo aviso) diferentes contenidos al mismo estudiante en la misma clase
Actividades a realizar
  1. Audios Diarios: 60 publicaciones subidas
  2. Actividades de la plataforma: 25 publicaciones subidas
  3. Tests: 9 tests aprobados subidas
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 6
  • Plataforma y herramientas: Conocer todo el contenido del ANKI.
  • Herramienta de reducción de ruido: Que pueda entender cualquier audio de reducción de ruido

Despedidas

¡Nos vemos luego, cocodrilo!

See you soon

Nos vemos pronto

See you soon, my friend!

¡Nos vemos pronto, amigo!

Take care

Cuídate

Take care and stay safe!

¡Cuídate y mantente a salvo!

Nos vemos mañana

See you tomorrow at school!

¡Nos vemos mañana en la escuela!

Nos vemos la próxima

¡Nos vemos la próxima, John!

Que tengas un buen día

Have a good day at work!

¡Que tengas un buen día en el trabajo!

¡Que tengan un lindo día, todos!

¡Que tengas un gran día por delante!

Notas Generales
Objetivo

Lograr que los estudiantes pasen con éxito todas las habilidades y demuestren que tienen los conocimientos necesarios que se requieren para ser certificados como un hablante de inglés en nivel A1

¿Hasta dónde se evalua en esta prueba?

Esta semana se estudia desde el módulo Choco Turbo hasta el módulo Semana 11: A1 TESTS PARA APROBAR EL NIVEL A1

Notas profesor

Este es el formato que el docente debe llenar https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1M6ymm7p4ZyLHwivDCiutwZ9XufRZbJIzYYVEzYUS3Yw/edit?gid=0#gid=0

Saludos

Los saludos deben ser reales. Un estudiante dice un saludo a otro compañero y este debe darle una respuesta.

Traducción

Frase Ejemplo

¡Buenos días a todos!

A1 Evaluación Vocabulario
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor?
  1. Muestra una lectura al estudiante y esté debe traducir lo que dice ese texto. Obs: Si el estudiante no puede interpretar lo que está leyendo, debe decir el significado de las palabras. Las palabras en negrita dentro de los textos indican palabras claves que tuvieron un refuerzo especial en la plataforma
  2. También debe hacer la prueba del ANKI: Cada estudiante abre su ANKI y va diciendo el significado de cada una de las tarjetas. Debe hacer un mínimo de 10 tarjetas en 1 minutos
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante?

Ser capaz de reconocer el significado de la palabra

Lecturas para evaluar el vocabulario
Evaluación 1 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students’ Version):

This story is about a boy and his sister. They are playing in the yard. He has many toys and she wants to use them.
"Can I play with this car?" she said.
"You can take one, but not all," he replied.

Their dad was at home when he saw them. "What are you doing?" he asked.
"We are playing," they said.
He smiled and gave them a snack.
"This is for you. You have been good," he said.

Later, they read a book about animals. Each animal is different. Some are big, some are small.
"How do animals live?" she asked.
"It depends on where they live," he replied.
There is a bear in the forest and a fish in the sea.

If you want to know more, read books.
Books can help you learn so much.
These books are not boring, but fun.
Other kids had fun with them, too.
They said, "Reading is fun!"

Which book will you choose next?
Will it be about dogs or cats?
By reading, you learn from stories.
An idea grows up from each page.
As you grow, you learn more.

Do your best, and read all you can!

Evaluación 2 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 2

One day, a girl saw some birds in her yard. She would make a picture because she like birds. She gave it to him.

She went into the house. “It is time to draw,” she said. She has pencils and paper.
“Look! I will draw two birds this time.”

She wanted to know more, so she began to write.
“I want to go to the park to see more birds,” she said.
“There are a number of birds there,” Dad said.

“But we have no way to go now.”
“We could ask the people next door,” he said.

“My friend has a bike,” she said. “I can go with him.”
“It is better than walking,” Dad said.
“It is the first time for this.”

She took her water bottle and bag. She had been ready all week.
“Let’s call Amy and ask who wants to go.”

At the park, she saw a bird with oil on its wings.
“Now I can find many birds!” she said.

They walked a long way and sat down under a tree.
They stayed all day. She did many pictures.

“You get better!” Dad said.
More kids come to see what she made.
“You may help others learn,” said a boy.

This part was the best part of her week.
There were birds flying over the trees.
The birds made a new sound.

“Let’s take a photo!” Dad said.
“Only a little wind today,” she said.
“It was work, but it was fun.”
“I know this place is very nice,” she said.

Evaluación 3 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 3

One day, after lunch, we went back to class.
The teacher said, “I have a good story for you. Look at me and listen.”

She said, “This is our book. I will read just one page. The boy’s name is Tom.”
She read the sentence: “The man is kind.”

I think it is fun when teachers say stories.
“It is a great story,” said Sam.
“Where did you get it?” he asked.

“It can help us read better,” she said.
We read through the book. It was so much fun.

We had to finish before we go home.
“Make a line,” the teacher said.
“Go to the right, not the left.”

“I want to read too,” said Anna.
She asked, “What means this word?”

My dad is old, but he reads to me.
He said, “If you find any hard words, ask.”

We all had the same book.
I will tell my mom about it.
The boy in the story can run fast.

I like to follow the words with my finger.
The teacher came to help me.
I want to read more books now.

We had to show the page to a friend.
“I will also draw the boy,” said Kim.
We looked around the room. Everyone smiled.

Let’s form a team to read.
We picked three kids. I was happy.

“I see one small cat in the book,” said Max.
The teacher said, “Now we will set the book on the shelf.”

We put it there and went to the door.
“It is the end of class,” she said.

“Does everyone have the paper?”
We took another one, well made.

The cat was not large, not big, but it was cute.
We must read that page again!

“Tom is nice. He can even help the cat.”
“It is such a sweet story,” I said.

We clapped, because we loved it.
“Now, we will turn the lights off,” the teacher said.

“Here is your bag,” she told me.
“Why do you smile so much?” she asked.

Lecturas para evaluar el vocabulario
Evaluación 1 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students’ Version):

This story is about a boy and his sister. They are playing in the yard. He has many toys and she wants to use them.
"Can I play with this car?" she said.
"You can take one, but not all," he replied.

Their dad was at home when he saw them. "What are you doing?" he asked.
"We are playing," they said.
He smiled and gave them a snack.
"This is for you. You have been good," he said.

Later, they read a book about animals. Each animal is different. Some are big, some are small.
"How do animals live?" she asked.
"It depends on where they live," he replied.
There is a bear in the forest and a fish in the sea.

If you want to know more, read books.
Books can help you learn so much.
These books are not boring, but fun.
Other kids had fun with them, too.
They said, "Reading is fun!"

Which book will you choose next?
Will it be about dogs or cats?
By reading, you learn from stories.
An idea grows up from each page.
As you grow, you learn more.

Do your best, and read all you can!

Evaluación 2 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 2

One day, a girl saw some birds in her yard. She would make a picture because she like birds. She gave it to him.

She went into the house. “It is time to draw,” she said. She has pencils and paper.
“Look! I will draw two birds this time.”

She wanted to know more, so she began to write.
“I want to go to the park to see more birds,” she said.
“There are a number of birds there,” Dad said.

“But we have no way to go now.”
“We could ask the people next door,” he said.

“My friend has a bike,” she said. “I can go with him.”
“It is better than walking,” Dad said.
“It is the first time for this.”

She took her water bottle and bag. She had been ready all week.
“Let’s call Amy and ask who wants to go.”

At the park, she saw a bird with oil on its wings.
“Now I can find many birds!” she said.

They walked a long way and sat down under a tree.
They stayed all day. She did many pictures.

“You get better!” Dad said.
More kids come to see what she made.
“You may help others learn,” said a boy.

This part was the best part of her week.
There were birds flying over the trees.
The birds made a new sound.

“Let’s take a photo!” Dad said.
“Only a little wind today,” she said.
“It was work, but it was fun.”
“I know this place is very nice,” she said.

Evaluación 3 Vocabulario Nivel A1

Reading Text (Students’ Version): 3

One day, after lunch, we went back to class.
The teacher said, “I have a good story for you. Look at me and listen.”

She said, “This is our book. I will read just one page. The boy’s name is Tom.”
She read the sentence: “The man is kind.”

I think it is fun when teachers say stories.
“It is a great story,” said Sam.
“Where did you get it?” he asked.

“It can help us read better,” she said.
We read through the book. It was so much fun.

We had to finish before we go home.
“Make a line,” the teacher said.
“Go to the right, not the left.”

“I want to read too,” said Anna.
She asked, “What means this word?”

My dad is old, but he reads to me.
He said, “If you find any hard words, ask.”

We all had the same book.
I will tell my mom about it.
The boy in the story can run fast.

I like to follow the words with my finger.
The teacher came to help me.
I want to read more books now.

We had to show the page to a friend.
“I will also draw the boy,” said Kim.
We looked around the room. Everyone smiled.

Let’s form a team to read.
We picked three kids. I was happy.

“I see one small cat in the book,” said Max.
The teacher said, “Now we will set the book on the shelf.”

We put it there and went to the door.
“It is the end of class,” she said.

“Does everyone have the paper?”
We took another one, well made.

The cat was not large, not big, but it was cute.
We must read that page again!

“Tom is nice. He can even help the cat.”
“It is such a sweet story,” I said.

We clapped, because we loved it.
“Now, we will turn the lights off,” the teacher said.

“Here is your bag,” she told me.
“Why do you smile so much?” she asked.

A1 Evaluación Temas
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 2

Hace las preguntas para evaluar los temas que debe conocer en ese nivel como familia, info personal; aunque reconocemos que no se ha abarcado completamente.

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 2

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel básico

Preguntas para evaluar los temas
Tema 1: 1. Personal Information & Identity

  1. What’s your name?

  2. Where are you from?

  3. How old are you?

  4. Do you have brothers or sisters?

  5. What’s your mother's name?

  6. What’s your father's job?

  7. Do you have a big family?

  8. Are you married?

  9. Do you have children?

  10. What are your children’s names?

  11. What time do you wake up?

  12. What do you usually eat for breakfast?

  13. Do you like coffee or tea?

  14. What time do you go to bed?

  15. Can you cook?

  16. What do you do on weekends?

  17. What’s your favorite food?

  18. Do you speak English?

  19. What other languages do you speak?

  20. What’s your favorite color?

  21. What do you do? (What's your job?)

  22. Where do you live?

  23. Do you live in a house or an apartment?

  24. What’s your address?

  25. What’s your phone number?

  26. What’s your email address?

  27. What’s the weather like today?

  28. What day is it today?

  29. What time is it now?

  30. What’s your favorite day of the week?

  31. What do you do in the morning?

  32. What do you do in the evening?

  33. Do you have any pets?

  34. What’s your favorite animal?

  35. What’s your favorite sport?

  36. Can you play the guitar?

  37. What music do you like?

  38. What’s your favorite movie?

  39. What do you do in your free time?

  40. What time do you start work?

  41. What time do you finish work?

  42. Do you like traveling?

  43. Have you ever been to another country?

  44. Do you like learning English?

  45. What’s your favorite English word?

  46. What clothes are you wearing now?

  47. What do you usually wear to work?

  48. What’s your best friend’s name?

  49. Where does your best friend live?

  50. Tell me about your family.

Tema 2: 2. Family

  1. Who is your mom?

  2. What’s your dad’s name?

  3. Do you have a brother?

  4. How many sisters do you have?

  5. Is your grandma alive?

  6. Where does your grandpa live?

  7. Is your baby brother funny?

  8. How old is your child?

  9. What does your mom do?

  10. Does your dad like music?

  11. Do you live with your parents?

  12. How many children do you have?

  13. Is your husband at home now?

  14. What’s your wife’s name?

  15. Do you have a son or a daughter?

  16. Do your cousins live near you?

  17. Does your uncle visit often?

  18. What does your aunt like to cook?

  19. How many siblings do you have?

  20. Does your cousin have a pet?

  21. Do you have any grandchildren?

  22. What’s your nephew’s name?

  23. Is your niece still a child?

  24. Do you like your stepmom?

  25. Where does your stepdad work?

  26. Do you have a stepson or a stepdaughter?

  27. Is your partner friendly?

  28. Are you engaged?

  29. Was your grandpa a teacher?

  30. Who is your mother-in-law?

  31. Are you a twin?

  32. Do you have any adopted siblings?

  33. Who is the tallest in your family?

  34. Is your sister older than you?

  35. Are your parents kind?

  36. Do you live in a big household?

  37. Is your mom strict or relaxed?

  38. Who is the youngest in your family?

  39. Do you know your ancestors?

  40. How many people live in your house?

  41. Do you have a stepbrother?

  42. How old is your stepsister?

  43. Do you visit your great-grandparents?

  44. Do you have a half-brother or half-sister?

  45. Is your family close or distant?

  46. Who is the oldest person in your family?

  47. Do you know your family’s lineage?

  48. Who is the matriarch in your family?

  49. Are you close to your kin?

  50. Will you visit your family next weekend?

  23. Do you listen to music during the day?

  37. Is your mom strict or relaxed?

  38. Who is the youngest in your family?

  39. Do you know your ancestors?

  40. How many people live in your house?

  41. Do you have a stepbrother?

  42. How old is your stepsister?

  43. Do you visit your great-grandparents?

  44. Do you have a half-brother or half-sister?

  45. Is your family close or distant?

  46. Who is the oldest person in your family?

  47. Do you know your family’s lineage?

  48. Who is the matriarch in your family?

  49. Are you close to your kin?

  50. Will you visit your family next weekend?

Tema 3: 3. Daily Routines ⏰🪥🍽️

  1. What time do you get up?

  2. Do you brush your teeth every morning?

  3. What do you do after breakfast?

  4. What time do you go to school or work?

  7. What time do you have lunch?

  8. Do you go to bed early or late?

  9. What do you do in the afternoon?

  10. Do you make your bed every day?

  11. What time do you finish work or school?

  12. Do you cook dinner?

  13. Do you watch TV in the evening?

  14. What time do you go to sleep?

  15. Do you use your phone before sleeping?

  16. Do you clean your room every day?

  17. What do you do on weekends?

  18. Do you drink coffee or tea in the morning?

  19. What time do you leave your house?

  20. Do you walk or take a bus to school/work?

  21. Do you study at night?

  22. What do you do before you sleep?

  23. Do you listen to music during the day?

  24. What time do you eat dinner?

  25. Do you do the same things every day?

A1 Evaluación Listening
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 3
  1. Opción 1: El profesor coloca un audio de reductores de ruido y el estudiante dice qué dijo el audio y lo traduce al español. (El estudiante dice: She’s tall - Ella es alta)
  2. Opción 2: El docente lee los reductores y el estudiante dice qué dijo el audio y lo traduce al español. (El estudiante dice: She’s tall - Ella es alta)
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 3

Debe poder entender los siguientes audios.

A1 Evaluación Comprensión
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 4

Va a evaluar las estructuras que debe manejar en ese nivel como tiempos y verbos.

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 4

Debe poder comprender cualquiera de las siguientes lecturas

Lecturas a Evaluar
Lectura 1 Comprensión Nivel A1

1. My Family

I have a small family. I live with my parents and my brother. My mother is a teacher, and my father is a doctor. My brother is 10 years old. He likes to play soccer. We have a dog. Its name is Max. We love Max very much.

2. My House

I live in a big house. There are three bedrooms, a kitchen, a living room, and two bathrooms. My bedroom is small, but I like it. There is a bed, a desk, and a chair in my room. I also have a window with a nice view.

3. My Best Friend

My best friend is Maria. She is 20 years old. She lives in my neighborhood. We like to study and play together. Maria is very funny and kind. She likes to draw and listen to music. I like her because she always helps me.

Lectura 2 Comprensión Nivel A1

4. My Favorite Food

I love pizza! My favorite pizza has cheese, tomatoes, and chicken. I also like pasta and rice. For dessert, I like ice cream and chocolate. On weekends, my family eats dinner at a restaurant. We always enjoy the food!

5. A Day at School

I go to school from Monday to Friday. My classes start at 8:00 a.m. and finish at 3:00 p.m. My favorite subject is English. I also like math, but it is a little difficult. At school, I talk with my friends and play in the park during lunch.

6. My Hobbies

I have many hobbies. I like to play basketball and swim. I also like to read books and watch movies. On Saturdays, I go to the park to ride my bike. I enjoy drawing pictures, too. Hobbies make me happy.

7. The Weather

Today, the weather is sunny and warm. I like sunny days because I can go outside. In the summer, it is very hot, but I enjoy swimming. In the winter, it is cold and sometimes snowy. I wear a coat, scarf, and gloves in winter.

Lectura 3 Comprensión Nivel A1

Dayana: I need your help, can you help me please?
Richard: Sure, tell me what you need

Dayana: What time is it?
Richard: It's 8 o'clock

Dayana: What's your phone number?
Richard: It's 3103534870

Dayana: What's your email address?
Richard: It's chocoenglish@gmail.com

Dayana: How do you say “arroz”?
Richard: Rice

Dayana: Are you married?
Richard: Yes, I'm married

Lectura 4 Comprensión Nivel A1

Dayana: How was your day?
Richard: It was great, I really enjoyed it

Dayana: How was your weekend?
Richard: It was really bad, I couldn't do much

Dayana: Who’s your best friend?
Richard: My best friend is my cousin, Marta

Dayana: Do you have siblings?
Richard: Yeah, I have siblings

Dayana: How many siblings do you have?
Richard: Yeah, I have 6 siblings: 1 sister and 5 brothers

Dayana: Do you have children?
Richard: Yeah, I have children

Dayana: How many children do you have?
Richard: I've got 4 kids: 1 boy and 3 girls

Dayana: Do you have friends?
Richard: Yeah, I've got friends

Dayana: How many friends do you have?
Richard: Wow, I've got a lot of friends

Lectura 5 Comprensión Nivel A1

I study English every day. 📚 I like my academy, Choco Inglés, because it’s mine, and I can practice by myself on the platform, which helps me learn English fast. 🚀 Learning English is my passion. ❤️

He studies English every day. 📘 He likes his academy, Choco Inglés, because it’s his, and he can practice by himself on the platform, which helps him learn English fast. 🏅 Learning English is his passion. 💪

They study English every day. 🎓 They like their academy, Choco Inglés, because it’s theirs, and they can practice by themselves on the platform, which helps them learn English fast. 🚀 Learning English is their passion. 💜

She studies English every day. 📖 She likes her academy, Choco Inglés, because it’s hers, and she can practice by herself on the platform, which helps her learn English fast. 🏆 Learning English is her passion. 💃

You study English every day. 📘 You like your academy, Choco Inglés, because it’s yours, and you can practice by yourselves on the platform, which helps you learn English fast. 🏅 Learning English is your passion. 💪

A1 Evaluación Speaking
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 5

Hace las preguntas para evaluar su capacidad de comunicarse y hablar en inglés

Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 5

Ser capaz de responder las preguntas con una respuesta en nivel básico

Preguntas para evaluar el speaking
  1. How are you?
  2. What's your name?
  3. Where are you from?
  4. How old are you?
  5. When’s your birthday?
  6. Where do you live?
  7. What do you do?
  8. Where do you work/study?
  9. What's your favorite [book/movie/food/hobby/color]?
  10. What time is it?
  11. I need your help, can you help me please?
  12. What do you think about money/politics…?
  13. What will you do tomorrow?
  14. Do you have any plans for the weekend?
  15. Do you like to eat/play/sleep?
  16. What do you do in your free time?
  17. What's your phone number/email address?
  18. How was your day/weekend?
  19. Who’s your best friend?
  20. Do you have siblings/children/friends? How many?
  21. How do you say “arroz”?
  22. Are you married/single/engaged?
  23. I would like to know a little bit about you
  24. What would you do if…
  25. Would you like a sandwich?
  26. Would you like some water?
  27. Would you like to go to the park?
  28. Would you like to meet my friend?
  29. Would you like to watch a movie?
  30. Is it cold?
  31. Is it sunny today?
  32. What’s the weather like?
  33. Is it raining now?
  34. Can I have a coffee, please?
  35. What do you have the menu?
  36. Do you like pizza?
  37. Can you say "sorry"?
  38. How do you say "thank you"?
  39. Can you repeat, please?
  40. Can you open the door?
  41. Where is the bathroom?
  42. How do I go to the park?
A1 Evaluación Herramientas
Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 6
  • Asegurarse de que todos los estudiantes tienen las actividades de este nivel realizadas para poder ser aprobados en esta evaluación.
  • El profesor hace una evaluación del ANKI de cada estudiante tal y como se hace en las clases en vivo regulares; la diferencia radica en que el profesor evalúa (sin previo aviso) diferentes contenidos al mismo estudiante en la misma clase
Actividades a realizar
  1. Audios Diarios: 60 publicaciones subidas
  2. Actividades de la plataforma: 25 publicaciones subidas
  3. Tests: 9 tests aprobados subidas
Evaluación: ¿Qué debe poder hacer el estudiante? 6
  • Plataforma y herramientas: Conocer todo el contenido del ANKI.
  • Herramienta de reducción de ruido: Que pueda entender cualquier audio de reducción de ruido

Frase en inglés

Traducción al español

Do I speak well?

¿Hablo bien?

Do I work hard?

¿Trabajo duro?

Do you eat breakfast?

¿Desayunas?

Do you like music?

¿Te gusta la música?

Do you all understand?

¿Ustedes entienden?

Do you all want coffee?

¿Ustedes quieren café?

Do we need more time?

¿Necesitamos más tiempo?

Do we study together?

¿Estudiamos juntos?

Do they live nearby?

¿Ellos viven cerca?

Do they play sports?

¿Ellos practican deportes?

Does she dance well?

¿Ella baila bien?

Does she speak Spanish?

¿Ella habla español?

Does he drive a car?

¿Él conduce un coche?

Does he know the answer?

¿Él sabe la respuesta?

Does it cost much?

¿Cuesta mucho?

Does it work properly?

¿Funciona correctamente?

Yes, I do speak well.

Sí, yo hablo bien.

Yes, I do work hard.

Sí, yo trabajo duro.

Yes, you do eat breakfast.

Sí, tú desayunas.

Yes, you do like music.

Sí, te gusta la música.

Yes, you all do understand.

Sí, ustedes entienden.

Yes, you all do want coffee.

Sí, ustedes quieren café.

Yes, we do need more time.

Sí, necesitamos más tiempo.

Yes, we do study together.

Sí, estudiamos juntos.

Sí, ellos viven cerca.

Sí, ellos practican deportes.

Sí, ella baila bien.

Sí, ella habla español.

Sí, él conduce un coche.

Yes, he does know the answer.

Sí, él sabe la respuesta.

Yes, it does cost much.

Sí, cuesta mucho.

Yes, it does work properly.

Sí, funciona correctamente.

No, I don't speak well.

No, no hablo bien.

No, I don't work hard.

Capacidad: ¿Qué va a hacer el profesor? 6
  • Asegurarse de que todos los estudiantes tienen las actividades de este nivel realizadas para poder ser aprobados en esta evaluación.
  • El profesor hace una evaluación del ANKI de cada estudiante tal y como se hace en las clases en vivo regulares; la diferencia radica en que el profesor evalúa (sin previo aviso) diferentes contenidos al mismo estudiante en la misma clase
Actividades a realizar
  1. Audios Diarios: 60 publicaciones subidas
  2. Actividades de la plataforma: 25 publicaciones subidas
  3. Tests: 9 tests aprobados subidas

No entiendo cómo funciona esto.

I don’t understand

I don’t understand how this works.

¿Qué es lo que quieres decir?

¿Qué es lo que quieres decir con eso?

What do you mean?

What do you mean by that?

Sin embargo

Sin embargo, necesitamos otra opinión.

However

However, we need another opinion.

Hace años

Hace años, vivía en otra ciudad.

Years ago

Years ago, I lived in another city.

Primero que todo

Primero que todo, quiero agradecerles.

First of all

First of all, I want to thank you.

Yo no creo que

Yo no creo que eso sea verdad.

I don’t believe that

I don’t believe that’s true.

Yo creo que

Yo creo que todos podemos.

I believe that

I believe that we can.

Despedidas

Las despedidas deben ser reales. Un estudiante se despide de un compañero y este debe darle una respuesta, despidiéndose también.

Despedidas Básicos

Palabra

Traducción

Frase Ejemplo

Traducción Frase Ejemplo

Bye

Adiós

Bye! See you soon!

¡Adiós! ¡Nos vemos pronto!

Goodbye

Adiós (formal)

Goodbye, take care!

Adiós, ¡cuídate!

See you later

Nos vemos luego

See you later, alligator!

¡Nos vemos luego, cocodrilo!

See you soon

Nos vemos pronto

See you soon, my friend!

¡Nos vemos pronto, amigo!

Take care

Cuídate

Take care and stay safe!

¡Cuídate y mantente a salvo!

See you tomorrow

Nos vemos mañana

See you tomorrow at school!

¡Nos vemos mañana en la escuela!

See you next time

Nos vemos la próxima

See you next time, John!

¡Nos vemos la próxima, John!

Have a good day

Que tengas un buen día

Have a good day at work!

¡Que tengas un buen día en el trabajo!

Have a nice day

Que tengas un lindo día

Have a nice day, everyone!

¡Que tengan un lindo día, todos!

Have a great day

Que tengas un gran día

Have a great day ahead!

¡Que tengas un gran día por delante!

¡Te veo luego, amigo!

I gotta go

Me tengo que ir

I gotta go, talk to you later!

Me tengo que ir, ¡hablamos luego!

Talk to you later

Hablamos luego

Talk to you later, okay?

Hablamos luego, ¿ok?

Until next time

Hasta la próxima

Until next time, buddy!

¡Hasta la próxima, amigo!

Have a good one

Que te vaya bien

Have a good one, take care!

¡Que te vaya bien, cuídate!

Me largo (informal)

Peace out, guys!

¡Me largo, chicos!

Later

Nos vemos (informal)

Later, dude!

¡Nos vemos, amigo!

Until we meet again, my friend!

Hasta que nos veamos de nuevo, amigo!

Stay safe

Mantente a salvo

¡Mantente a salvo en tu viaje!
Despedidas Avanzados

Farewell

Despedida formal

Farewell, my dear friend.

Adiós, mi querido amigo.

It was nice seeing you

Fue un gusto verte de nuevo.

¡Te deseo lo mejor en tu nuevo trabajo!
